data.text: Do no evil, so shall no evil overtake thee.
Depart from wrong, and it shall turn aside from thee.
My son, sow not upon the furrows of unrighteousness,
Seek not of the Lord preeminence,
Justify not thyself in the presence of the Lord;
Seek not to be a judge,
Sin not against the multitude of the city,
Bind not up sin twice;
Say not, He will look upon the multitude of my gifts,
Be not fainthearted in thy prayer;
Laugh not a man to scorn when he is in the bitterness of his soul;
Devise not a lie against thy brother;
Love not to make any manner of lie;
Prate not in the multitude of elders;
Hate not laborious work;
Number not thyself among the multitude of sinners:
Humble thy soul greatly;
Change not a friend for a thing indifferent;
Forgo not a wise and good wife;
Entreat not evil a servant that worketh truly,
Let thy soul love a wise servant;
Hast thou cattle? have an eye to them;
Hast thou children? correct them,
Hast thou daughters? give heed to their body,
Give thy daughter in marriage, and thou shalt have accomplished a great matter:
Hast thou a wife after thy mind? cast her not out:
Give glory to thy father with thy whole heart;
Remember that of them thou wast born:
Fear the Lord with all thy soul;
With all thy strength love him that made thee;
Fear the Lord, and glorify the priest;
Also to the poor man stretch out thy hand,
A gift hath grace in the sight of every man living;
Be not wanting to them that weep;
Be not slow to visit a sick man;
In all thy Or, words  matters remember thy last end,
